name: Help Yourself
comments: "It's where you're at, not where you've been". Amy Winehouse there, inadvertently perfectly describing the memoryless property of Markov chains.
perfect for a summer day soundtrack....love amy winehouse!
Beautiful song...so ironic...wish she could have helped herself.

Yeah, it was excluded from the US version for some reason. I didn't own it either for a long time, but I finally got it after ordering the Frank & Back to Black box set last fall. I always knew the song existed existed, but to me it was brand new when I heard it last year. Knowing she had died made the lyrics seem especially poignant. I can appreciate people wishing that she "could have helped herself" and all that--the notion of course being that she needed to take her own advice--but I still appreciate the subtle wisdom in these lyrics. Despite her problems, I think she was an old soul.
Bummer, this song isn't on my Frank album!
"Yeah, I'm So Young" - true, she was too young to die..
hearing her voice is soothing yet painful at the same time :(........................but wth @ beyonce as a similar artist!?!??!?! In what life ? LOL
I like this song~ wish she could have helped herself

wish she could have helped herself... [5]

You guys who are saying that you wish she could have helped herself don't understand addictions. :( Addiction is formally defined as a "brain disease" that means that the structure of the brain and it's chemicals and receptors are altered. When are they going to direct research to "resetting" the brain? Call me jaded but I think it's likely because treatment is big business ... and like other treatments that go on and on with short term results... a cure would put them all out of business. We see this with cancer all the time. Same is true with addiction... which of course has a large behavioral component as well. --Maria Grandonico Ludlam
